DOC.brief_summary: This study examine effect portable pulsed electromagnetic field ( PEMF ) device ( MD Cure , Aerotel , USA ) compare sham device patient-reported outcome pain function patient either acute/subacute chronic low back pain ( LBP ) .
DOC.brief_title: The Effect Pulsed Electromagnetic Field Therapy Patients With Low Back Pain
DOC.detailed_description: This study double-blind , placebo-controlled , randomize pilot study compare usual care + PEMF usual care + sham . The investigator recruit patient LBP University Bridgeport chiropractic clinic , enroll 80 total subject : 40 acute subacute LBP , 40 chronic LBP . Within population investigator assign 20 subject receive usual care + PEMF , 20 receive usual care + sham . The investigator track treatment initiate discontinued trial . Patients agree participate randomly give functional PEMF device sham unit . Patients clinician blind assignment . All subject give instruction daily use device , continue receive usual follow-up UBCC clinic indicate . The investigator collect patient-reported measure pain function pain baseline , 6 week , 12 week , collect data adverse effect visit 6 12 week .
DOC.criteria: UBCC patient complaint LBP intensity 4/10 great Numerical Rating Scale diagnosis mechanical LBP condition age 1870 year fluency write spoken English female subject , postmenopausal , surgically sterile , abstinent , agree practice effective method birth control duration study sexually active willingness participate study evidence sign informed consent form current LBP complaint 3/10 less Numerical Rating Scale diagnosis suspicion LBP cause cancer , infection , refer visceral pain , inflammatory arthropathy , nonmechanical process current plan pregnancy electricallybased implanted device pacemaker defibrillator , spinal cord stimulators , insulin pump ; metallic implant ( e.g . surgical fusion construct , disc replacement ) low back status post lumbosacral spine surgery ; significant mental health comorbidities severe depression , schizoaffective disorder , suicidal ideation inability understand and/or complete component informed consent process without assistance another person ( e.g . without proxy ) inability adhere comply treatment protocol .
